alert.note: Alert for Modoc County; Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 29 at 7:25PM PST until January 31 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM TUESDAY TO 10 PM PST WEDNESDAY... ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 10 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, south winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 60 mph expected. For the Wind Advisory, south winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...For the High Wind Warning, portions of Highway 97 in Northeast Siskiyou County including Macdoel and Dorris; higher terrain in Klamath, Lake, and Modoc Counties including the Winter rim, Warner Mountains including at Cedar Pass, and south of Canby. Additionally, areas near Klamath Lake are included in the warning as well. For the advisory, most other areas of Klamath, Lake, and Modoc Counties. This includes Highways 31, 139, 140, 299, and 395 and the cities of Alturas, Lakeview, Klamath Falls, and Chiloquin. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, from 10 PM Tuesday to 10 PM PST Wednesday. For the High Wind Warning, from 1 AM to 10 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds can blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds will begin on Tuesday, but the strongest winds will occur Wednesday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.

area.areaDesc: Modoc County; Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties
